title: Loading Cargo
items: Dock the ship (without crashing, please)
Battle pirates - remember, no looting unless they started it
Send the crew to buy burgers, preferably with extra cheese
Make sure the cargo doesn't spontaneously combust... again
Double-check that all crates are labeled 'fragile' for maximum drama
Ensure the ship isn't secretly carrying treasure maps – we don't need another mutiny

title: Weekly Tasks
items: Read through this week's report – pretend you're actually interested
Plan next week's meetings – preferably at the most inconvenient times
Update the project status – bonus points for making it sound like we’ve done something
Check that all life vests are accounted for (pirates are unpredictable)
Sharpen your pencil (it’s the little things that count)
Pretend to understand the latest regulations – nod convincingly

title: Monthly Tasks
items: Review financial report – try not to cry when you see the numbers
Conduct employee reviews – don’t get too personal, we’re all just here for the paycheck
Plan next month's goals – or just copy last month's goals and hope no one notices
Inspect the ship's hull for holes – and if you find one, just pretend it was always there
Update inventory – remember, one more 'mysteriously missing' crate will raise suspicions
Make sure the coffee machine works – no one functions on an empty cup

title: General Ship Maintenance
items: Check lifeboats – you never know when a sudden trip to a deserted island might occur
Inspect the radar – maybe this time we'll actually find land before it’s too late
Clean the deck – if you see a seagull, give it a stern look to maintain authority
Ensure the anchor is actually functional – not just 'there for decoration'
Make sure the captain doesn't get lost during his afternoon nap
Check the toilet paper supply – essential for morale and hygiene
